Role description         The HR Strategy and Transformation Digital Enablement team implements core, firmwide Talent applications leveraged to support key Talent strategies and processes. As Talent identifies opportunities to transform the way we deliver services, technology solutions will need to be implemented or updated to provide an enhanced experience to our professionals and to drive operational efficiency and effective improvements across Talent.        Our team - in partnership with our Talent stakeholders, IT partners, and technology vendors - supports the design, configuration, and implementation of technology solutions that will enhance the employee experience, optimize productivity, and create value for the Firm. We are seeking a highly motivated and seasoned talent technology professional to design, implement, and monitor these solutions as part of our multi-year transformation roadmap. This role will manage a portfolio of projects and initiatives that involve the Talent Services organization - the team that manages core human resource activities.        This role will focus on implementation, enhancement, and operations for a new core enabling technology for end-to-end case management, workflow management, knowledge, and communications. Additionally, this role will serve as a conduit to ITS and be a single point of contact for both new initiatives and the maintenance and risk resolution for existing digital assets. This individual will incubate and drive projects in partnership with the Talent Services teams and ITS as well as contribute to other projects as needed. This role requires extensive experience with case management and workflow management technology, Talent process and domain experience. Additionally, this individual requires strong project management skills and stakeholder management experience.           Work you'll do         As the Digital Enablement Manager, you will:            Lead the design, implementation, and testing of critical talent enabling technologies.      Manage third party vendor relationships, when applicable, resolve break-fixes, prioritize ongoing enhancements, and monitor new development - with a focus on downstream impacts.      Serve as a strategic advisor to Talent and coordinate with subject matter advisors to ensure the appropriate Talent representation is included in preparation, design, and testing workshops.      Interface with the HRST Intelligent Automation team to bring new and innovative automation and machine learning solutions to the Talent Services organization.      Support the Digital Enablement leadership team with support for key programs and projects.      Create business cases for new initiatives and monitor on-going metrics to demonstrate the return-on-investment, cost avoidance, and value creation of digital solutions.      Collaborate with other subject matter experts, such as People Analytics and User Experience team members, to propose innovative digital solutions that shape the customer experience.      Design workshops and other planning sessions to ensure that system configurations, process designs, and testing plans meet the talent business owners' needs.      Perform other role-related duties as needed.            The team         The HR Strategy and Transformation team is reimagining how Talent fuels our Deloitte businesses through innovative, customer-centric, digitally enabled talent services. We take a human-centered approach to creating unified, personalized, and intuitive experiences that use data and digital solutions to optimize the way that Talent works, the workforce, and the workplace.           Qualifications             Bachelor's degree and 10+ years of relevant work experience      Problem solving skills and consultative approach with an ability to collaborate with team members on best practices      Expertise leading talent technology implementations or enhancing other enterprise digital talent solutions - from concept to deployment      Talent subject matter experience      Leadership experience in a dynamic, complex, client- and team-focused environment with minimal oversight and an agile mindset      Experience with end-to-end case management as well as Cloud technology      Proven stakeholder management and relationship-building skills      Strong communication skills, both verbal and written      Proficient with Microsoft Office technology (e.g., PowerPoint, Excel, OneNote, Word, Teams)      Knowledge of the professional services industry is preferred      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

PayFlex has been in the benefits administration business for more than 30 years, dedicated to health care account offerings. We help nearly three million members across the country fund their out-of-pocket health care expenses with pre-tax dollars and lower their taxable income. Our experience has propelled us forward to evolve our offerings beyond the standard pre-tax offerings and with a refocused purpose to make it simple to plan, pay, and save for personal well-being. As part of CVS Health, we’re on the verge of revolutionizing the consumer well-being journey.  At PayFlex we know that the culture of our organization is the key to our success. If you align to our purpose, then you may be the right person to join our inspiring, dynamic, and fun team. We can’t wait to meet you! PayFlex is looking for curious and innovative data scientists to join our team. Our data scientists will tackle a range of complex business problems every day. They will play a significant role in improving our understanding of our member journeys, as well as, deepening our client relationships.  As a data scientist at PayFlex, you will be part of a team building best in class statistical models to deliver new business insights; developing, testing and validating unsupervised modeling techniques; and, creating and deploying long term tools to continually evolve business capabilities to compete with current and future market trends.   Use strong programming skills to explore, examine, and interpret large volumes of both structured and unstructured data Build predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns, and recommend solutions Work with internal stakeholders to translate their business needs into analytic projects Provide insights to the business to enable data-driven decision making Visualize data in user friendly ways Develops and participates in presentations to internal stakeholders on analytic results and solutions  Required Qualifications Technical skills of at least 2-3 years in some of the following:   Hadoop, Tableau, R, SAS, SQL, and/or Python Strong knowledge of algorithms and predictive models Experience with large data sets  COVID Requirements   COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.  You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.   Preferred Qualifications  Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Physics, Engineering or related discipline. Knowledge of Medicare a plus  Education  Bachelors degree in: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science (Graduate degree preferred)  Business Overview Bring your heart to CVS Health Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.  Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an affirmative action employer, and is an equal opportunity employer, as are the physician-owned businesses for which CVS Health provides management services. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, promotion, or any other personnel action based on race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

job_title: Realtime Interaction Marketing Platform Specialist, Experience Management
job_Description: Realtime Interaction Marketing Platform Specialist, Experience Management         Preferred Locations: Nationwide           Overview         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels.        Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and Hux by Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end to end.        Hux is the Human Experience Platform by Deloitte Digital. We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement, and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.         Hux by Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale.           Work you'll do         As a Realtime Interaction Marketing Studio Platform (Manager/Specialist) you will be responsible for advising, maintaining, and operating Salesforce Interaction Studio solutions on behalf of our clients. As the primary support role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and troubleshooting new or existing:            Sitemap code working with client's web teams and tag managers as well as supporting      Custom Interaction Studio templates      Integrations to and from Interaction Studio      Web and server-side campaigns      Einstein Recipes & associated configurations        In addition to working with internal and client teams to provide expertise and work products associated with the above work types you will also guide the team on designing and building new campaigns and templates as the platform is adopted.           The team         Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce, and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.        We serve our clients through the following types of work:            Cross-channel customer engagement strategy, design and development (web, mobile, social, physical)      eCommerce strategy, implementation and operations      Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions      Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions      Marketing analytics implementation and operations      Advertising campaign ideation, development and execution Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results            Qualifications             Experience in design/development activities to build solutions in Interaction Studio      Proven experience with enterprise web content management systems and tag management products, implementing tagging across channel and integration into reporting and marketing systems      Front end development experiences With knowledge of common front-end frameworks      Familiarity with middleware ETL platforms and ETL integration constructs      Experience within the Core SFMC suite (Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Email Studio) as well as adjacent products such as SF CDP, either within a consultancy, an agency or internal email operations team      Experience with database and data modeling across omni-channel inputs and internal systems      Developed segmentation and audiences within various customer/marketing systems      Travel up 30% (while 30% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)      Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.        Preferred            Support of implementation of web & mobile personalization tools (Adobe Target, Oracle Maxymiser, Optimizely, Google Optimize)      Experience with:            Microsoft TypeScript (JavaScript)        CDP Management        CDP Rules Management           Development within Email Service Providers (SFMC, Adobe, Responsys, etc.)      Designed and developed recommendations, orchestrations or rulesets within marketing automation or delivery systems.        Experience in artificial intelligence or machine learning practices        AMC2021        XMAMC2022

At KeyCaliber, we are an early-stage company doing big things to advance cybersecurity programs in meaningful ways. You will work side by side with a team of industry veterans who possess decades of experience defending networks and quantifying cyber risk. Using cutting-edge technology, data visualization, and advanced machine learning, we are empowering organizations to prioritize their most precious cybersecurity resources. We are here to make the fight not just manageable but winnable and we need someone like you to be a part of our mission!  We are looking for a Data Scientist who is willing to take on new challenges and work in a highly collaborative environment with security and risk subject matter experts, developers, and other data scientists. You will turn terabytes of security data into unique and actionable insights to help infosec and IT practitioners completely rethink how they defend and manage their organizations. We are solving several important problems that prevent our customers from unlocking the true value of their security investment and making the most efficient use of their team's most precious commodity: time. The ideal candidate is one who is self-driven, excited to learn new things, and can help us improve our product to delight our customers. There is always something new to learn, and the team both supports and challenges each other so that the best solutions win.  What You Will Do  Devise new techniques (supervised and unsupervised) to solve a number of different use cases including:  Assess the criticality of an asset to business operations from raw telemetry data such as network traffic, vulnerability scan results, user behavior logs, and more.  Cluster and identify all the assets that comprise an internal application from telemetry data  Leverage industry-standard frameworks and techniques with our unique insights to deliver credible risk metrics that can be used to drive cyber security decision making and strategy  Several additional myriad problems that will require fast experimentation and validation to determine viable approaches to predictive modeling  Work with our data engineers to identify and acquire the data sources and features necessary for successfully implementing our ML models in realtime and at scale  Validate the effectiveness of our models and statistical algorithms by establishing a system to automatically measure their precision, accuracy and recall against labeled data  Help prepare reports and assessments to demonstrate the value of our analytics to prospects and customers refining how we present our findings and proposing new visualization methods  Clearly, document, track, and communicate your findings  Gain experience working in a collaborative environment that adheres to lean software principles to deliver value  About You:  We realize that there is rarely a “perfect candidate” for any role and value finding the right person with a great background that can quickly come up to speed and embrace learning on the job.  While these are some of the qualifications that we feel are important for success in this role, if you think you would be a great fit and are a little unsure about any particular area, let’s talk!  You have:  A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or Statistics  2+ years of professional experience contributing to the development of ML models that solve business problems We will be experimenting with and leveraging several types of ML techniques but a background in developing classification models are our top priority  An ability to leverage core statistical methods such as correlation analysis, hypothesis testing, evaluating distributions, etc.  Some knowledge of Bayesian statistics and hierarchical models or an affinity to learn them  Enough experience and knowledge of Python to be able to explore data with a Jupyter notebook, build a model with sci-kit-learn and assess the model’s efficacy  Strong communication skills and collaborative team spirit  We would also be thrilled if you meet any of the following qualifications but they are definitely not required:   Masters or Ph.D  Experience quantifying risk in terms of $$ or numerical scores and indices  Experience with Spark, AWS services, and related tools  Familiarity with cybersecurity concepts and terminology  Benefits Expand your career in cyber security, one of the fastest-growing industries in the country  First-hand experience in working from the ground up at an early-stage startup with tons of opportunities for fast career growth and progression  A collaborative and productive company culture where everyone’s values and opinions are respected and people are empowered to do their best work  Work for a company that prioritizes people and cares about creating a strong culture and healthy work/life balance  Ability to work 100% remotely  Health, dental, and vision insurance  Unlimited vacation   This role does not offer U.S. visa sponsorship.

Raytheon Technologies                              Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.                To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed.                          We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team who will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data processes and creating data pipeline architectures, as well as optimizing data flows for RTX collaboration tools and services. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our tenant engineers, database architects, act as a data analysts and data scientist and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.        Responsibilities include but are not limited to:        Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture working in Microsoft Government cloud environment        Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.     Assist with process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.     Recommend and build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, scripting and cloud technologies (Azure).     Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.           Preferred Qualifications:        Strong familiarity extracting data from Azure tenants, MS O365 environment.        Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.     Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets.     Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.     Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.     Strong project management and organizational skills.     Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.     Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases     Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Kubernetes, Airflow, etc.     Experience with Azure cloud services     Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.           Education         Typically requires a University Degree or equivalent experience and a minimum 7 years of experience, or an Advanced Degree and a minimum 5 years experience.        Location:  Remote        Required Status:         US Citizen or US Person required as work may involve visibility to ITAR related projects.

job_title: VP, Managed Markets, Access Value & Strategy
job_Description: VP, Managed Markets Access, Value, and Strategy             The VP of Managed Markets Access, Value, and Strategy will play a critical role through all stages of BioXcel’s product lifecycles to optimize patient access, brand value and competitive advantage. This position will drive the successful launch of BXCL501 with a focus on achieving broad formulary access across GPO/IDNs, hospital accounts and PBMs. Responsibilities include:              Leading the overall market access launch plan for BXCL501 and follow-on indications, including strategy for pricing, hospital-associated reimbursement, payer contracting and formulary coverage       Managing the distribution and trade functions, including identification, contracting, and management of third-party logistics vendor, state licensing, as well as wholesaler and hospital/retail pharmacy relationships       Sourcing, training, and managing the Managed Markets Access team       Developing marketing plans and communications programs to promote BXCL501’s clinical and economic benefits with payers and customer accounts.              Effectively and efficiently interfacing with customers, internal and external team members, partners and vendors is a critical component of this position.                      Accountabilities:              Partner cross-functionally to lead the implementation of US Payer access strategies and payer launch readiness plans for BXCL501 and develop strategies for pipeline indications/products       Develop payer channel and customer insights to inform launch access strategies and annual operating plans       Define critical processes and timelines across payer types to establish rapid access, formulary coverage and reimbursement       Develop payer segmentation and prioritization plans with defined customer engagement timelines       Develop/evolve payer value proposition and associated messaging platform       Support channel optimization planning across IDNs, hospital systems/hospitals, long-term care, drug treatment centers, and the retail marketplace       Lead the creation, editing, production and deployment of digital and non-digital communications programs (message platform and sales aid, educational programs, conference booths and materials, relationship marketing programs, promotional campaigns, training materials, etc.) to support the overall product strategy and corporate objectives with managed markets customers       Develop success metrics and measurements for market access initiatives and programs.       Generate insights from monitoring and analyzing market trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities and overcome potential challenges.        Lead the Managed Markets Marketing team efforts to support field activity                       Qualifications:              Bachelor’s degree required       Minimum 15 years of pharmaceutical industry experience and minimum of 7 years in market access leadership positions       People management experience and documented success       Expertise in the GPO/IDN, hospital and payer marketplace       Highly analytical in decision making and strategic approach       Ability to work across multiple stakeholders        Strong creative and conceptual thinking skills        Clear communication skills, both verbal/presentation and written        Strong interpersonal skills        Financial/budgetary experience        Ability to travel up to 35%        Position is remote based with travel to New Haven, CT as required                              Your Path to Endless Opportunities                   If you’re looking to push the envelope and join an innovative company where technology meets drug discovery and development and you’re enthusiastic, creative, with a passion for cutting-edge research, you should join our team! We are looking for highly motivated, passionate employees to help us drive technology solutions for discovering breakthrough treatments for our portfolio of oncology and neuroscience programs, as well as for our partners across major therapeutic areas.                  About BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc .                  BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc. is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on drug development that utilizes artificial intelligence to identify improved therapies in neuroscience and immuno-oncology. BTI's drug re-innovation approach leverages existing approved drugs and/or clinically evaluated product candidates together with big data and proprietary machine learning algorithms to identify new therapeutic indices. BTI's two most advanced clinical development programs are BXCL501, an investigational sublingual thin film formulation in development for acute treatment of agitation resulting from neuropsychiatric disorders, and BXCL701, an investigational orally administered systemic innate immunity activator in development for treatment of a rare form of prostate cancer and for treatment of pancreatic cancer in combination with other immuno-oncology agents. For more information, please visit www.bioxceltherapeutics.com.                  EOE/M/F/V/SO             BioXcel Therapeutics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status.

job_title: Senior Director, Oncology; Tumor Profiling Solutions
job_Description: Overview  Sema4 is a patient-centered health intelligence company founded on the idea that more information, deeper analysis, and increased engagement will improve the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. Sema4 is dedicated to transforming healthcare by building dynamic models of human health and defining optimal, individualized health trajectories, starting in the areas of reproductive health and oncology. Centrellis™, our innovative health intelligence platform, is enabling us to generate a more complete understanding of disease and wellness and to provide science-driven solutions to the most pressing medical needs. Sema4 believes that patients should be treated as partners, and that data should be shared for the benefit of all. Sema4 Signal, Sema4's oncology solutions business is on a mission to advance precision oncology care, from prevention to treatment to remission. We work on the cutting edge of genomics, data science, machine learning, and network modeling, combining those capabilities with best-in-class digital engagement and last mile services to equip patients with personalized health information and give providers unique insights to inform the prevention or treatment of disease. We are motivated by pioneering novel solutions that can be implemented at scale. Sema4 is seeking a Tumor Profiling Solutions Sr. Director to launch and own our tissue and liquid based genomic portfolios across the lifecycle and support the development of the overall strategy for the Oncology franchise. In this role, you will be primary responsible for identifying and bringing these solutions to market partnering across the organization with research, lab, sales, marketing, digital, operations and business development. You will need to define key markets, understand competition, set strategy, and manage new product launches, including tracking KPIs and adjusting strategy as needed. Your success will be measured by revenue generated by products launched to market as well as their contribution to Sema4's strategic objectives. Responsibilities  Determines customers' needs and desires by specifying the research needed to obtain market information. Develops and manages the P&L for products Determines the nature and scope of present and future products lines by reviewing product specifications and requirements, appraising new product ideas and/or product or packaging changes. Assesses market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' . Provides source data for product line communications by defining product marketing communication objectives. Assesses product market data by calling on customers with field salespeople and evaluating sales call results. Provides information for management by preparing short-term and long-term sales forecasts and special reports and analyses; answering questions and requests. Develops business cases to support bringing new products to market by analyzing proposed product requirements and product development programs and preparing return-on-investment analyses; Introduces and markets new by developing time-integrated plans with sales, advertising, and product Completes operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees; following up on work results. Works collaboratively across research, lab, operations, digital, sales, and partnerships to bring to market in a collaborative and coordinated way Maintains product management staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Job Requirements    6+ years of experience in product management, preferably in Oncology or related therapeutic area Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management P&L responsibility Experience managing a product in market and/or product development (ideally 4+ years) Able to position a product in market to "win". Domain expertise in oncology; genetic testing specifically a plus Training and solid technical background in the oncology research, lab, pharmaceutical, or curation space Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization Excellent written and verbal communication skills MS/BS degree science related studies Management consulting experience a plus Creative problem solver Able to work in a start-up environment Self-starter; scrappy; determined to get stuff done #tsp-sema4

Leads development and execution of highly complex and large-scale data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data to generate insights and addresses reporting needs  Writes highly complex ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) processes, designs database systems and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing  Leverages broad knowledge of market-leading edge technologies and specialized expertise in programming skills such as Python or Java or any of the major languages to solve challenging analytical problems  Analyzes current information technology environments to identify and assess critical capabilities and recommend solutions  Collaborates cross-functionally to build and convert algorithms and models into production systems to support enterprise initiatives  Develop frameworks, standards & reference material for architecture and associated products based on company’s legal and security policies. Provides guidance for enterprise-wide technology roadmap  Acts as thought leader to provide expert technical consultation to senior IT management strategic planning groups  Motivates team members and probes into technical details, and mentors' others to do the same  Required Qualifications  10 or more years of progressively complex related experience  Proven ability to leverage multiple tools and programming languages to analyze and manipulate large data sets from disparate data sources and build innovative solutions  Proven experience in developing solutions and services in clouds. GCP is preferred.  COVID Requirements   COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.  You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.   Preferred Qualifications  Expert experience with bash shell scripts, UNIX utilities & UNIX Commands  Expertise in Java, Python, Hive, Cassandra, Pig, MySQL or NoSQL or similar Expert knowledge in Hadoop architecture, HDFS commands and experience designing & optimizing queries against data in the HDFS environment  Expert experience implementing complex, enterprise-wide data transformation and processing solutions  Experience and knowledge of healthcare industry  Experience and knowledge in machine learning and AI  Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine Learning, or related discipline.  Master’s degree or PhD preferred.   Business Overview At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

job_title: Labs - Senior Model Ops Developer - Manager
job_Description: PwC Labs is focused on standardizing, automating, delivering tools and processes and exploring emerging technologies that drive efficiency and enable our people to reimagine the possible. Process improvement, transformation, effective use of innovative technology and data & analytics, and leveraging alternative delivery solutions are key areas of focus to drive additional value for our firm. The AI Lab focuses on implementing solutions that impact efficiency and effectiveness of our technology functions. Process improvement, transformation, effective use of technology and data & analytics, and leveraging alternative delivery are key areas to drive value and continue to be recognized as the leading professional services firm. AI Lab is focused on identifying and prioritizing emerging technologies to get the most out of our investments. To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future. As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to: Develop new skills outside of comfort zone. Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively. Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development. Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations. Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations. Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations. Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making. Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients. Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties. Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points. Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct. Job Requirements and Preferences :   Basic Qualifications :   Minimum Degree Required : Bachelor Degree   Additional Educational Requirements : In lieu of a Bachelor Degree, 12 years of professional experience involving technology-focused process improvements, transformations, and/or system implementations Minimum Years of Experience : 4 year(s)   Preferred Qualifications :   Degree Preferred : Master Degree   Preferred Fields of Study : Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, Business Analytics, Computer and Information Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Computer Engineering   Preferred Knowledge/Skills : Emerging Tech Lab Developers create rapid proofs of concept to test hypotheses about how emerging technologies can be applied to business use cases. We learn and explore at the forefront of Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Internet of Things, Robotics, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality. The lab’s role is to generate prototypes, demos and learnings that PwC teams and clients can use when deciding how to apply and invest in emerging technologies. Demonstrates extensive abilities and/or a proven record of success as a team leader, as well as the following preferred technical qualifications: Working experience in data management, deploying and managing ML models on cloud platforms like Azure, AWS or GCP; Deploying machine learning models in the cloud for real time and batch inference use cases; Designing, developing and deploying models based on modern deep learning architecture; Building scalable machine learning systems; Understanding of containers and container orchestration systems(Kubernetes / Docker); Demonstrating the ability to continuously learn new technologies and quickly evaluate their technical and commercial viability; Understanding of machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit Learn and algorithms such as random forests, ensemble methods, deep neural networks, convolutional neural networks etc.); Building machine learning models and systems, interpreting their output, and communicating the results; Creating end-to-end technology prototypes and/or machine learning models for a given business use case or application; Balancing multiple projects simultaneously and a working ability to meet deadlines and balance multiple priorities; Managing projects with autonomy and leading teams as large as 10 people; Owning responsibility for multiple deadlines and ensuring that projects are completed on-time; and, Demonstrating proven presentation skills. At PwC, our work model includes three ways of working: virtual, in-person, and flex (a hybrid of in-person and virtual). Visit the following link to learn more: https://pwc.to/ways-we-work.  PwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law. PwC is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.  For positions based in San Francisco, consideration of qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records will be in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  For positions in Colorado, visit the following link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act: https://pwc.to/coloradoifsmanager.  #LI-Remote

job_title: Senior Principle Engineer, Model Based Enterprise Tools (Hybrid)
job_Description: Pratt & Whitney is working to once again transform the future of flight—designing, building and servicing engines unlike any the world has ever seen. And because transformation begins from within, we’re seeking the people to drive it. So, calling all curious.        In addition to transforming the future of flight, we are also transforming how and where we work. Pratt & Whitney is laser focused on offering flexibility to our employees. We’ve introduced role types (Onsite, Hybrid, or Remote) and now list them in the job posting title so candidates know where they will operate in our blended work environment.           Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for        this role.        Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance workers, as they are essential to the development of our engines.        Hybrid: Employees who are working in Hybrid roles will work regularly both onsite and offsite.        Remote: Employees who are working in Remote roles will work primarily offsite (from home).        Come ready to explore and you’ll find a place where your talent takes flight—beyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we’ll welcome you into a tight-knit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that’s evolving fast to the future.        Where the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up.        Are you ready to go beyond?           Note: Hybrid and Remote roles at many of our sites are currently working from home because of COVID-19 protocols. Candidates will learn more about role type and current site status throughout the recruiting process.        The Pratt & Whitney MB-DMI Team (Engineering, Internal Operations, Supply Chain, Quality, DT, software developers) is looking for a dedicated individual to be responsible for developing a coordinated MB-DMI data interoperability strategy between the Engineering, Internal Operations, Supply Chain, Quality, and Digital Technology (DT) organizations.        The successful candidate will have strong communication skills, be self-motivated, persistent, and focused on results. They must be able to drive urgency, drive alignment and decision making, demonstrate leadership through building trust and positively influencing others, challenge the status quo with a continuous improvement mentality, and foster learning that is integrated with development. The main deliverable is to develop and implement new processes and tools that achieve tangible results.        Key Responsibilities:         Define and implement a coordinated MB-DMI data interoperability strategy between the Engineering, Internal Operations, Supply Chain, Quality, and Digital Technology organizations.      Ensure Model Based Definition data elements (geometry, annotations, attributes, product characteristics, presentation states) are created with human and machine-readable compliance and digitally consumed in a traceable manner in Internal and External Operations.      Have deep technical experience in how MBD interoperable file formats (e.g. STEP 242, QIF, JT) are best suited to support consumption into downstream frameworks (e.g. CAD, CAM, CAI, and other business process applications).      Evaluate the maturity of the interoperable formats to support MBD data elements, assess impact of maturity to the digital thread, and drive the identification and closure of risk mitigation steps where maturity gaps are identified.      Represent Engineering in relevant industry standards bodies (PDES, DMSC, ASME, etc.).      Work with software vendors in the evaluation, development, debugging, and evolution of software tools to support MB-DMI goals.      Develop and maintain a multi-year strategic roadmap on interoperability that incorporates P&W learning, current state maturity evaluation, and market research for new tools, trends, and functionality in the interoperability space.      Advise MBD teams on the application of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) approaches that maximize machine-readability and comply with the latest ASME standards for application and interpretation.      Coordinate with external hardware suppliers to understand their MBE digital maturity and support their digital adoption.      Create Engineering Standard Work and training material on the application of MBD to maximize machine readability and to comply with the latest industry standards for definition application and interpretation.      Create Engineering Standard Work and training material for the governance of creating, validating and consuming derived digital product definition data elements and formats.           Basic Qualifications:         Bachelor's Degree in Engineering with 10+ years’ of relevant experience.      Advanced Degree with 7+ years’ of relevant experience.      Experience with CAD and PLM software.      US Citizenship due to government contracts.           Preferred Qualifications:         Experience with Siemens NX and Teamcenter.      Extensive knowledge on PMI reuse and repurpose to a stature of Subject Matter Expert level.      Certification in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T).      Providing GD&T training.      Expertise with MBD related standards (ASME Y14.5-2018, ASME Y14.41-2019, ASME Y14.47-2019, MIL-STD-31000B) and interoperable file formats (STEP 242, QIF, JT).      Experience with MBD related translation and validation software (ITI CADIQ, Capvidia MBDVidia/CompareVidia, Elysium 3Dx Suite, etc.).      Programming with NX Open API (.Net, Java, Python), JavaScript, web development.      Familiarity with working in an Agile framework.

About Us              BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc. (BTI) is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on drug development that utilizes artificial intelligence to identify improved therapies in neuroscience and immuno-oncology. We are a growing AI team that actively works with neuroscientists to build the next version of an AI eco-system that supports and augments the entire drug re-innovation process.                                   Job Overview  The successful candidate will be part of a multidisciplinary effort to identify new potential indications for drugs that have a clinical safety profile as well as expanding on indications for drugs currently under development. He/She will work with the Artificial Intelligence and neuroscience group to develop and work with both structured and unstructured data to build a labeled properties graph for further graph-based data-science strategies. The end goal is to predict viable drug candidates for new opportunities, i.e., existing drugs with the right pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties, to be successful for indications in psychiatric and neuro-rare disorders. He/She must be willing to source and develop ingestion pipelines for big data.                          Responsibilities             Participate in planning and the execution of strategies to identify candidate compounds for their therapeutic potential in human neuro-psychiatric disorders, including ways of identifying, sourcing an ingesting relevant data.  Participate on team discussions with the neuroscience and artificial intelligence teams in Europe and the US  Identify and source data and ingest into graph databases information to assist in the search for existing drugs and in-licensing opportunities that may be used in novel neuro-rare or psychiatric indications.  Consult with the intellectual property team regarding scientific strategy of the IP estate.  Collaborate with the BTI AI advisory board, scientists and KOLs in the field of AI-based methodologies.  Participate in preparing presentations for use at corporate meetings, scientific conferences, and business development meetings.                          Qualifications             For this position we are looking for a strong communicator with a sense of project ownership, curiosity, and the professional skill set to excel in an open, highly collaborative environment.  Specific Qualifications for Software/Data Engineer  BS degree in Computer Science.  Highly fluent in Python, SQL, and Cypher, and the ability to quickly learn new languages and tools.  Experience working in a collaborative CI/CD software development environment, including use of git, peer code review, and independent authorship of well-tested, easily maintained, scalable, documented code.  A can-do attitude and ability to work in a diverse multi-disciplinary team, on fast-paced, high-impact projects.  Definite Plus will be:  Some familiarity with life sciences  Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4j.  Experience mining and integrating databases and developing data visualizations.  Enjoy collaborating with a diverse team of both technical and non-technical experts.                          Your Path to Endless Opportunities                   If you’re looking to push the envelope and join an innovative company where technology meets drug discovery and development and you’re enthusiastic, creative, with a passion for cutting-edge research, you should join our team! We are looking for highly motivated, passionate employees to help us drive technology solutions for discovering breakthrough treatments for our portfolio of oncology and neuroscience programs, as well as for our partners across major therapeutic areas.                  About BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc .                  BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc. is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on drug development that utilizes artificial intelligence to identify improved therapies in neuroscience and immuno-oncology. BTI's drug re-innovation approach leverages existing approved drugs and/or clinically evaluated product candidates together with big data and proprietary machine learning algorithms to identify new therapeutic indices. BTI's two most advanced clinical development programs are BXCL501, an investigational sublingual thin film formulation in development for acute treatment of agitation resulting from neuropsychiatric disorders, and BXCL701, an investigational orally administered systemic innate immunity activator in development for treatment of a rare form of prostate cancer and for treatment of pancreatic cancer in combination with other immuno-oncology agents. For more information, please visit www.bioxceltherapeutics.com.                  EOE/M/F/V/SO             BioXcel Therapeutics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status.

job_title: Software Intelligent Quality Engineering Testing - Senior Consultant
job_Description: FY22 AMI     Software Intelligent Quality Engineering Testing     - Senior Consultant         Are you talented, detail-oriented software automation testing professional, interested in working in a team atmosphere to create innovative solutions that solve our clients' most complex issues? Are you interested in creating elegant, effective solutions, while continually learning and expanding your skills?            Work you'll do      As an Intelligent Automation Testing Senior Consultant you will bring considerable technical expertise to deliver effective solutions to clients including the following:            Acting as the lead, interfacing between clients and our Deloitte teams      Helping to create testing solutions to meet clients' business needs      Leading the testing of our custom technology solutions            The Team            Application Modernization & Innovation      At Deloitte Consulting LLP, Deloitte Application Modernization & Innovation consultants leverage the best of innovative technology, people, and delivery approaches to help our clients dream, explore, build, and optimize their future. The AMI practice delivers end-to-end technology solutions to enable and improve our clients' core business operations. AM&I is composed of three different areas- Service Delivery & Business Design, Application Modernization & Migration, and Quality Engineering.            Intelligent Automation Testing Senior Consultants should have the following skills and experience:             4 years of relevant consulting or industry experience      Experience using intelligent automation testing tools      At least 2 years experience with defining the testing strategy for large scale programs and ensuring requirements traceability throughout the system development lifecycle and leading Testing efforts, including experience with all phases of testing: System Integration, User Acceptance, and Performance Testing      At least 2 years' experience driving the quality assurance processes and gaining delivery buy-in from executive leadership      At least 2 years of testing experience in different environments including one or more of the following: client-server, service-oriented architecture, web-based, mainframe-based and three-tier architectures      Experience with the following: MicroFocus UFT, Rational Tooling, and Open Source Automation Tools (ex: Selenium, Cucumber, OpSoapUI, PostMan, RESTAssured, Mockito)      Experience with Test & Defect Management tools - MicroFocus ALM, JIRA      Experience with at least one Scripting language - Shell, VBScript, Perl, or Python      Experience with Source Control Systems - SVN or GIT      Experience with Build tools - Maven, CircleCI      Experience in Automated Reporting      Experience in CI/CD/CT tools - Jenkins, Bamboo, Quickbuild      Experience in Cloud web and mobile testing platforms - SauceLabs, Browserstack      Travel up to 50% (While 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)      Limited Immigration sponsorship may be available            In addition, successful Senior Consultants will have the following preferred background:             Experience in robotics solutions such as UIPath, AutomationAnywhere, or BluePrism (certification is a plus)      Hands-on Experience in machine learning models such as neural networks (eg: TensorFlow)      Experience in Python NLTK or similar natural language processing technology      Experience in Mobile Native App automation      Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment      Eagerness to mentor and grow junior staff      Testing Techniques - Understand the various approaches used in testing, including (e.g. desk checking), white-box (logic drive), black-box (requirements driven), load testing, coverage testing, and regression testing.      Technical expertise in implementing industry-standard testing methodology and tools      Experience implementing testing best practices specific to the test planning and execution processes and gaining buy-in for changes from executives      A deep understanding of test planning and delivery challenges      Bachelor's degree (preferably in computer science or a related discipline)

LGC Clinical Diagnostics Business Unit is comprised of LGC Clinical Diagnostics, Inc. (formerly SeraCare Life Sciences & Maine Standards), Technopath Clinical Diagnostics, the Native Antigen Company, LGC Proficiency Testing & Thistle. Our 400+ employees operate FDA-registered and ISO 13485-accredited facilities in Maine (USA), Massachusetts (USA), Maryland (USA), Tipperary (Ireland), an ISO 9001-accredited facility in Oxford, UK and ISO 17043 facilities in Michigan (USA) and Johannesburg, South Africa. LGC Clinical Diagnostics is owned by LGC Group, a UK-headquartered life sciences measurement and testing business with >$510m of annual revenue and >3,500 employees globally.                         We are committed to improving patient healthcare by offering products and services that support accurate and reliable diagnostic results.                         The SAP Finance Techno-Functional Lead is responsible for guiding and eliciting business requirements and implementing them either directly (hands-on and collaboratively) or by working with consultants who have been contracted for a given enhancement or project. The scope includes production support, on-going maintenance, enhancements and projects within SAP, add-on applications to SAP, and integration to other systems. Current SAP modules include SD, MM, PP and FICO, with this role primarily accountable for FICO. Must be comfortable working with business to guide them through SAP changes requiring a cooperative effort. For example                    hands-on technical role for business run finance project (FICO Configuration)            project manager to drive overall coordination within the department and across the business            technical lead for Fixed Assets, ACH, etc.            Advise or consult for projects that are run by external consultants. Audit consultant’s SLDC deliverables for quality.                   Works independently at times and collaboratively at times with other employees and\or consultants.          Develops project artifacts and applies project management disciplines. job_title: Software Engineer ( Security Analytics/ML Eng)) - Opportunity for Working Remotely Bridgeport, CT
job_Description: Job Description                             The Security Analytics Engineering group is looking for a Software Engineer with experience and/or strong interest in the cyber threat landscape who will contribute to the development and validation of our threat detection analytics and the supporting infrastructure for both cloud-based and agent-based threat detection products. You’ll join a talented team of developers using a wide variety of new and cool technologies to help detection authors identify, research, author and test threat detections. You’ll build solutions and enable features that deliver value and arm our customers to prevent the next front page security breach. You’ll make a difference and help us win a huge market.         The teams focuses on using analytics, machine learning, and threat research on petabyte-scale data to deliver security value to millions of business users across thousands of businesses. The product portfolio is a part of the rapidly growing Carbon Black Cloud platform that delivers next-generation endpoint protection capabilities from the cloud. Now with the full resources of VMware, you have the opportunity to make an impact and build upon Carbon Black’s success.                Responsibilities                 Build out resilient and scalable components for our stream processing machinery and detection engines          Deliver high quality, clean code along with the rest of the dev team in all phases of the software development lifecycle as part of a Scrum team          Work closely with internal engineering and threat research teams to perform research and data analysis          Investigate functional problems, finding and fixing defects as needed                       Skills                 B.S./M.S in Computer Science or equivalent experience          2-4 years experience in designing and delivering commercial software products          Experience with big data, SQL, Spark/Hadoop and AWS environments          Expert level expertise programming in Python/JAVA and/or other languages and related software processes          Demonstrated aptitude in quickly mastering new languages, technologies and existing code bases          Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills                       Bonus Skills                 Security experience a big plus, but interest in security a must          Data analysis skills a plus                       This position is eligible for CarbonBlackUSA referral campaign                          Category :  Engineering and Technology   Subcategory:  Software Engineering   Experience:  Manager and Professional   Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time   Posted Date:  2022-04-01     VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.        Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

We are looking for talented individuals with an innovative mindset and technical skillset to join our growing team and work as part of NBI Product Engineering using the latest Java applications.        NBI houses prototyping, development and maintenance capabilities for a product portfolio that spans multiple software technologies including wearables, machine learning, advanced analytics, social/mobile, and more. An understanding of web application security and designing controls to guard against SQL injection, cross-site scripting etc.      An understanding of best practices such as test-driven development, industry established code quality standards and use of SonarQube plus usual design patterns.      Experience with NoSQL databases.      Knowledge of Java message broker technologies such as ActiveMQ and/or integration technologies like Mule.      Use of UML as part of software design tasks (Class, Action, Event and sequence diagrams)      Experience with Node.js, Groovy, Scala.      Ability to profile code for performance, tune application engines, and configure for web-scale.        #NBI22 #Product22         #NBI_I&P

We are searching for an innovative and experienced Sitecore developer. You should have been actively working with Sitecore for at least 5 years, and a preference towards those that have a Sitecore certification.      Our client, the State of Connecticut has been using Sitecore for 5 years and is looking to expand their usage of Sitecore and start taking advantage of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Personalization and more of the Sitecore Marketing Functions. Using Sitecore, we seek to create an AI layer on top of Sitecore to drive content creation and delivery for over 100 different State Websites. This is an exciting opportunity that creates unique challenges.      To set the stage for this endeavor, we first need to upgrade from Sitecore 9.3 to Sitecore 10.2 (or later). Candidates should have experience upgrading Sitecore and understand the challenges faced in upgrading large scale sites. This not only includes the Sitecore platform but also related services such as SOLR.      We need someone that has a passion for learning, self-development and loves knowing how things work. The successful candidate must be a self-starter and willing to drudge through issues when needed. They must be able to demonstrate expertise solving complex and unique challenges with innovative solutions. They must be a great communicator and collaborator, energetic and promote a sense of confidence. Communication directly with the customer will be required. The ability to multi-task and quickly adapt to changing priorities is important. We have a very team-oriented atmosphere and support one another as best as we can. The candidate is expected to work as part of a team in delivery successful solutions to our client.      You must be physically located in the United States. This can be a remote position. Some travel maybe needed to Connecticut.      Who We Are:      NIC Connecticut is a wholly owned subsidiary of Tyler Technologies in the NIC Division. Tyler Technologies has been in business for over 25 years providing modern services and applications to the public sector. Our passion is for using the latest in technology to deliver innovative solutions to our State Partners to help make government easier and more accessible to constituents.     Essential Responsibilities         Develop Sitecore features and components following Helix principles.      Using defined best practices install, maintain, debug a complex Sitecore environment.      Write clean, scalable, and readable code.      Maintain all code in source control.      Maintain documentation in Confluence.      Utilize Azure DevOps for code deployments.      Recommend process improvements to increase efficiency.      Integrate Sitecore with 3rd party applications.      Research and document technical solutions to complex requirements.      Assist Jr Software Developers as needed.      Coordinate with other software professionals and developers.      Debug and troubleshoot application errors.      Non Sitecore development as needed.      Act as a technical lead for implementation efforts.        Essential Requirements:         5+ years of C# .NET Development Experience      .NET Core  Entity Framework and Linq  NET MVC  NET Web API      5+ years of Sitecore Development      Expert level understanding of Sitecore installation, development and configuration best practices including but not limited to      Installation and configuration of Sitecore  Sitecore Helix  Configuration Layers  Zookeeper/SOLR  Creating pipelines, event handlers  Implementing Sitecore Analytics, Personalization  Sitecore Cortex  Sitecore Forms  Unicorn/TDS  Component development  Sitecore Headless      Experience integration Sitecore with 3rd party applications      Experience implementing CI/CD processing with Sitecore using Azure DevOps      Experience Upgrading Sitecore      Sitecore 9.3 Certification      5+ years RESTful API and microservice development including designing, building, testing, and deployment.      5+ years Object-Oriented design and development experience with knowledge of design patterns, and SOLID principles.      2+ Experience JS Frameworks (Angular, React, Vue)      Clear understanding of Serverless architectures      Strong understanding of the SDLC      SQL Server Development experience      Proficient with code versioning tools such as Bitbucket      HTML/CSS/JavaScript      Strong understand of Agile Methodologies        Nice to Have:         Salesforce Experience      Cloud Development in Azure      Experience using Containers (Docker, Kubernetes)      Azure DevOps experience        Education:         Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field         Job Type: Full-time      Salary Range: Based on experience         Location      Hartford, Connecticut             Travel      0-5%             Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career      Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and values guide everything we do. We’re also frequently recognized as a great workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.             Taking Care of You & Your Family      Your health and well-being are important to us. That’s why we invest in our team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Developer to join our KPMG Spark organization. job_title: Senior Director of Data and AI Strategy - Medical Imaging
job_Description: POSITION SUMMARY        The Senior Director of Data and AI Strategy is a senior level role, reporting directly to the Global Vice President of Business Development and Strategy, that requires experience and demonstratable success in spearheading strategy in emerging technology areas such as AI in the healthcare IT and imaging informatics markets.        This big idea thinker role is broadly accountable for defining the AI strategy for Change Healthcare Enterprise Imaging and detailing and transitioning a practical product and services model to leadership and product management. In addition, this role will be responsible for external thought leadership, client engagement and evangelism of the CHC AI solutions for medical imaging.        RESPONSIBILITIES            Developing and aligning AI strategy at a leadership level and distilling the strategy into practical product and services business models      Identifying and spearheading key partnerships, new business opportunities related to AI and supporting build vs. buy decisions      Working with cross-functional stakeholders to transition AI strategy to our product roadmap and development lifecycle      Responsible for external thought leadership with clients/industry and evangelism of AI roadmap and strategy.      Building and presenting business cases to support funding and execution of strategy      Being the client facing subject matter expert in critical sales engagements           MINIMUM JOB Qualifications        Education / Training:         Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Health Informatics, Engineering or a related technical discipline; or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, and/or work experience.           Business Experience:         8+ years of experience in health IT desired, preferably in one of the following digital segments: medical imaging, population health management, clinical workflow automation, clinical decision support.      5+ years of experience defining commercially successful AI solutions and/or strategies for medical imaging      3+ years of relevant experience with health data platforms and working knowledge of Health IT standards      Thought leadership in the area of new and emerging technologies in healthcare analytics, informatics, clinical workflow and patient pathways.           Specialized Knowledge / Skills:         Expertise with solutions, vendors and customers in medical imaging informatics, diagnostics and workflow settings and an expert of trends at vendor and provider levels.      Speaking engagements on “big idea” topics in industry-related events and related networks for medical imaging such as SIIM and RSNA on the topic of AI.      Current and proven influencer in AI thought leadership in medical imaging with organizations such as Stanford AI Lab, ACR, SIIM AI governance and/or other industry forums      Proven ability to rally industry interest to the point of action in areas of emerging technology and solutions      Establishing, communicating, and publishing strategic vision and strategy for technology and clinical solutions      Customer-facing presentation and information discovery that supports the successful delivery to clients      Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills within a multicultural environment.      Advanced problem solving and critical reasoning skills      Strong internal negotiating skills      Strong personal energy and ability to energize others      Ability to make timely decisions      Ability to manage multiple projects that might be geographically widespread           Working Conditions:     Up to 50% travel     Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!        COVID Vaccination Requirements        We remain committed to doing our part to ensure the health, safety, and well-being of our team members and our communities. As such, we require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment and we may require periodic testing for certain roles. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. Change Healthcare adheres to COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance.        Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Statement         Change Healthcare is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.
