Raytheon Technologies Corporation     Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.        To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed.        Raytheon Technologies Research Center     The Technology & Engineering organization is comprised of the global engineering function, several focused centers of expertise, and our advanced Research & Development Facility – the Research Center. By combining a passion for science with precision engineering, we create smart, sustainable solutions that prove we can do the big things the right way.        The  Postdoctoral program  is of limited length (1-2 years in duration). The postdoc will build expertise and experience and make valuable professional connections in an industrial research and development environment. At RTRC, we have active collaborations with top universities, and we strongly encourage participation in top-tier conferences like CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, AAAI. We also have several externally funded research projects and we encourage and support our staff to seek internal and external funding to develop multidisciplinary approaches to high-impact real world problems.        Job Description  Seeking a motivated and curious candidate for a  Computer Vision Postdoc  position in the Advanced Learning and Analytics team, part of the Aerothermal and Intelligent Systems Department at Raytheon Technologies Research Center.     The Advanced Learning and Analytics team researches and develops machine learning (ML), computer vision (CV), natural language processing and human computer interaction solutions for a variety of high impact real world problems in the aerospace, manufacturing and defense industries. We research and develop CV approaches for applications like autonomous flight, automated visual inspection of parts and robotic perception. We conduct basic and applied research in a stimulating multi-disciplinary environment where scientists, engineers, practitioners and subject matter experts collaborate and exchange experience.        Roles & Responsibilities         Research and develop novel Computer Vision solutions and implement them.      Collaborate with researchers from multiple disciplines to understand and tackle a variety of real-world problems.      Communicate research findings to technical and non-technical audiences.      Where possible, participate and publish in top-tier conferences.      Where possible, seek funding to start your own research directions.        We’re looking for a highly motivated candidate eager to use and extend state of the art CV approaches.     A strong candidate:         Has solid hands-on experience with state-of-the-art ML approaches, especially in computer vision and deep learning.      Can research, design and implement novel ML approaches for multi-modal data.      Demonstrates the potential to initiate and execute funding opportunities through internal and external R&D.      Can stay abreast of the latest developments in the field and champion new ideas and problem definitions.        Basic Qualifications         Hands-on experience in ML techniques, algorithms, off-the-shelf packages, such as Open CV, SciKitLearn and tensor flow, and development environments.      Expertise with scientific programming in python.      Ability to understand the details of an engineering problem statement, formulate it as an ML problem and identify candidate ML approaches.           Preferred Qualifications         Ability to work with 3D CAD models, familiarity with rendering processes/software, and understanding of basics of nonlinear optimization.      Experience with GPUs and multi-threaded programming for parallelization.      Strong mathematical background in statistics and linear algebra           Required Education  Candidates for this position are required to have recently completed a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science or a related field.        Work Authorization:  U.S. Person ( (U.S. Citizen or Permanent U.S. Resident/Green Card)        Location:  East Hartford, CT (relocation offered)

Arvinas is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company leading the way in targeted protein degradation therapeutics. Arvinas is the first company to focus solely on protein degradation and its platform technology is the most advanced in the field. Since its founding in 2013, Arvinas’ PROTAC® Discovery Engine has been driving the most significant breakthroughs in the industry. Arvinas’ pipeline encompasses a range of validated and undruggable targets in oncology, immuno-oncology, and neuroscience. This includes three clinical-stage programs: ARV-110 and ARV-766, which are being developed as potential treatments for men with late-line metastatic castrate-resistant prostate cancer, and ARV-471, which is being developed as a potential treatment for patients with breast cancer.  #TeamArvinas is made up of more than 300 passionate and curious employees, whose diverse thoughts and perspectives are highly valued. Arvinas employees embrace the freedom to pursue innovation, think creatively, and give back. They are driven by the company’s values and purpose – to improve the well-being of patients and families impacted by the devastating diseases Arvinas is working to treat. It’s an exciting time to be in drug development and it’s an exciting time to be at Arvinas. But don’t just take our word for it – here’s what Arvinas employees are saying. For more information, please visit www.arvinas.com.   Position Summary Arvinas is seeking an experienced High-Performance Compute (HPC) Senior Engineer to join the Infrastructure, Operations and Security (IOS) team and work in tandem with the IT Research and Development organization to architect and deliver leading-edge solutions. This role is an imperative conduit between IT other business areas such as Biology, Chemistry and Clinical. The ideal candidate has experience managing computational heavy workloads, by following infrastructure and operational best practices and is proficient in storage, hardware, operating systems, virtual machine technology and cloud computing.  This position reports to the Manager, IT Infrastructure and Operations and will be located at our headquarters in New Haven, CT. Most activities can be conducted remotely but quarterly onsite visits will be required to discuss roadmap and conduct team building activities.   Principal Responsibilities  Key responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:   Translate business requirements for data acquisition, visualization, and analysis, [including Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)] into technical requirements.  Define the technical requirements and data architecture for data intake, storage, management, and archival of large research data sets from internal and external groups.  Partner with internal IT and IT vendors on the specification, selection, and implementation of solutions to meet requirements. Lead or participate in vendor selection, contract negotiation, and the development of statements of work.  Partner with the IT Infrastructure & Operations Cloud engineering and Cyber Security teams to ensure all solutions are aligned with policies and procedures.  Provide full lifecycle ownership of applications and IT capabilities. This includes scoping and implementing new systems, maintaining existing systems, and making retirement/replacement recommendations.  Provide operational support as required for production systems, including end-user support, account management, configuration management, and change management.  Prepare system lifecycle documentation, end-user training and documentation, FAQs, and other documentation as required.  Perform other duties as assigned. Company Description  Detect's mission is to democratize healthcare by developing breakthrough technology that allows us to discover, develop, manufacture, and commercialize transformative cures for untreated genetic diseases. We are championing a new era of healthcare by writing DNA where it matters.  Detect is a well-funded, rapidly growing health-tech company founded by award-winning scientist and highly successful serial entrepreneur, Dr. Jonathan Rothberg. Detect benefits from being a 4Catalyzer company, an incubator of biotech and med device companies (most notably Butterfly Network) who have collectively raised over $700 million in funding.  Joining Detect is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.  Job Description  The Research & Development team at Detect designs and builds the engine behind our scalable diagnostic platform for COVID-19 and other molecular targets. We envision a testing platform so simple that it can be ultimately used in the home, allowing individuals to self-test on a routine basis and monitor their health & wellness over time. Come work alongside a world-class team of scientists and engineers to define the next generation of molecular testing.  As a Senior Scientist, Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, you will be responsible for conducting original research that contributes to the development of rapid, low-cost diagnostic products. You will oversee and execute on technology development projects that require innovative and original solutions. Leveraging skills in bioinformatics and multi-omics data analysis, you will actively investigate the abundance of and sequence-level variation in diagnostic target molecules. Such careful sequence analysis, including microbial (phylo)genomics, contributes to the design of Detect assays to ensure they are highly accurate and specific. You are also excited about nucleic acid and protein structural modeling, machine learning and scientific programming and can develop artificial intelligence models and computational tools. Senior scientists at Detect have a deep passion for computation and love knowing that they can apply their domain expertise to improve worldwide access to accurate diagnostics. You will work closely with experimentalists to generate large high-quality datasets that may be mined using statistical data modeling techniques to derive novel biological insights. You enjoy communicating about your work and are eager to collaborate as a valued member of a highly interdisciplinary and diverse team consisting of engineers and scientists. You search for creative solutions to the problems you encounter. You feel at home in a fast-paced pre-commercial startup and are comfortable rolling up your sleeves to contribute in any capacity.  As part of our team, your core responsibilities will be to:   Plan multi-month technology development projects and lead project teams consisting of scientists and engineers with diverse technical backgrounds  Carry out computational analysis of omics data and data from high-throughput biochemical assays, including algorithm implementation as well as bioinformatics programming  Effectively utilize relevant public and proprietary sequence databases and available resources as key inputs to computational models and informatics pipelines  Apply statistical and artificial intelligence concepts to effectively mine large biological datasets and train generative sequence models  Independently plan projects and subtasks such that milestones and resources may be monitored and actively tracked while simultaneously adapting readily to dynamic project needs  Clearly document omics pipelines, algorithms, and all code in a well-maintained and high-quality electronic laboratory notebook  Collaborate with software engineers and developers to transform your code into accessible computational tools for internal and external users  Prepare presentations and present data to an interdisciplinary technology team and serve as an internal technical resource for Detect  Disclose innovations and work closely with internal Detect stakeholders to secure intellectual property protection  Mentor and coach junior team members Qualifications  Baseline skills/experiences/attributes:   MS or PhD in bioinformatics, computer science, computational biology, genomics or related field with 2-5 years of experience  Proven record of innovative and independent problem-solving skills and application of computational tools to solve biological problems  Demonstrated expertise in the development of sequence analysis tools, bioinformatics programming, and knowledge and experience with high throughput sequence analysis  Knowledge of and experience with scripting languages (Python, Perl, R, Ruby)  Project management experience  Excellent written and oral communication   Ideally, you also have these skills/experiences/attributes (but it's ok if you don't!):   Experience working in fast-paced start-up environments  Familiarity with the design of inclusive and specific primers and probes for nucleic amplification assays  Hands-on experience with statistics, data mining, machine learning, and statistical data modeling techniques  Programming skills and experience with large genomic datasets and state-of-the-art bioinformatics tools  Familiarity with concepts, techniques, and common tools used for nucleic acid and protein structure modeling and thermodynamics  Familiarity with implementation and scale-up of informatics pipelines in a cloud environment  Experience working in a regulatory-compliant environment with rigorous documentation and Quality Control requirements    You Deeply Identify with Core Detect Values:   Put people first . Our colleagues and our customers come first. We respect each other and celebrate our diversity. We take joy in each other's success, and succeed or fail as a team  Eye of the owner . We have an ownership mindset and take responsibility for all of our decisions. No problem is someone else's problem. We are frugal and use company resources as if they were our own  No genius without grit . As innovators, we fail often but fast. We are tenacious. We push through adversity and keep getting up. We are problem solvers and always find a way  Err on the side of doing . We are scrappy and biased toward action — everyone is an individual contributor. We allow intuition to guide us when we have imperfect information  Move fast by working smart . We are inventors. We focus, plan, pursue, and adjust to make big things happen in a fraction of the time others can. We disagree and commit  Always be frank . We celebrate openness and diversity of opinion. We are transparent and candid but compassionate in our feedback, and are always honest to ourselves and our customers  Additional Information  We offer great perks:   Fully covered medical insurance plan, and dental & vision coverage - as a health-tech company, we place great worth on our teams' well-being  Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it  Equity - we want every employee to be a stakeholder  Pre-tax commuter benefits - we make your commute more reasonable  Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks  401k plan - we facilitate your retirement goals  Beautiful office near the ocean-front in historic Guilford, Connecticut  The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!   For this role, we provide visa assistance for qualified candidates.  Detect does not accept agency resumes.  Detect is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an Aerospace and Defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defense. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cybersecurity. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.        To realize our full potential, Raytheon Technologies is committed to creating a company where all employees are respected, valued and supported in the pursuit of their goals. We know companies that embrace diversity in all its forms not only deliver stronger business results, but also become a force for good, fueling stronger business performance and greater opportunity for employees, partners, investors and communities to succeed.        The following position is to join our Corporate or Research Center Team:        Raytheon Technologies Research Center  (RTRC) develops new technologies that enable the most innovative products in the world. Our researchers serve as expert technical consultants to Raytheon Technologies (RTX) businesses, lead government-sponsored research programs, and pursue their own creative ideas. From advanced mission systems for our warfighters to leading edge green propulsion, we combine innovation with product application to shape the future of technology.     The next generation of products demand that we break down traditional boundaries. If you enjoy crossing disciplines, employing your expertise in Operations Analysis to drive the design of a wide range of technologies, our Aerothermal and Intelligent Systems teams needs your skills.     Our  Senior Research Engineer  position demands strong operations research fundamentals coupled with a strong background in one or more of the following areas:         analytic and numerical physics-based modeling,      scalable exploration methods for large, discrete design spaces,      machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques (algebraic, topological, deep learning),      knowledge representation and reasoning, or      novel optimization methods, uncertainty quantification, and computational geometry.           On our team, you’ll leverage this expertise to build our capability around engagement, mission, and campaign modeling in relevant technology areas, such as integrated propulsion, power, and thermal management systems, next generation radars and missiles, and advanced mission systems.     RTRC was founded by some of the world’s greatest inventors. We helped build the Second Industrial Revolution and brought about a century of urbanization and globalization. Come help us build the next one.        Basic Qualifications:         Master's Degree or Ph.D. Mechanical, Aerospace, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering required      We will consider Ph.D. candidates with no formal experience. M.S. candidates must have 1+ year of experience in a relevant work environment      U.S. Citizen      Experience in military operations analysis and wargaming      Analytic modeling and programming skills in common languages      Demonstrated experience in publishing and presenting research           Preferred Qualifications:         Adaptability and the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment      Excellent communication skills, informal and formal presentation skills, and ability to foster positive relationships with internal and external partners      Ability to manage uncertain requirements, formulate a problem from ill-defined needs, develop approaches to solve problems, and recognize when additional subject matter expertise is needed      Experience developing externally funded programs with relevance to a particular research agenda      General understanding of FEA and CFD modeling      Active security clearance

Ad Operations Manager, Experience Management            Overview         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services, or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels.        Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater, and Hux by Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end to end.        Hux is the Human Experience Platform by Deloitte Digital. We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement, and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.         Hux by Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data, and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale.           Work you'll do         The Manager, Ad Operations will play an integral leadership role at Deloitte leading the AdOps team as part of our Paid Media unit. The Paid Media team helps to develop, and execute, omnichannel media plans spanning Digital Channels including but not limited to social, search programmatic, and direct partnerships. Within this team, we facilitate buying both programmatically and via direct partnerships across various mediums such as CTV, display, native, video & more. As a Senior Consultant, Ad Operations, you are responsible for being a subject matter expert (SME) on all technical and trafficking requirements across our ad tech stack. You will also assist in building a team of AdOps strategists who will execute an end-to-end trafficking process inclusive of all upfront tracking, tagging, testing tags, monitoring campaign delivery, creative rotation sheets, and building within Ad Servers (inclusive of DCM).           About You         You have a variety of experiences in the Programmatic & Media space spanning various client types, DSP experience, and ad type understanding. You have experience leading an early-stage high-growth team and a keen understanding of the internal processes necessary to scale. You have a strong skillset in data analysis and problem-solving with the ability to actively troubleshoot and escalate unique issues. You're deeply familiar with GTM [or other relevant tag management platforms] and have significant experience implementing Floodlights, Pixels, and leading tagging strategies. You have a robust knowledge of the end-to-end trafficking process and experience working across teams (site and creative) to traffic proper creative against advertisements and pixels across sites. You should feel comfortable leading, mentoring, and training a team of junior AdOps individuals.           Responsibilities             Is the team lead on all technical and trafficking requirements across ad serving platforms (setup, discrepancies, troubleshooting, QA, etc.), and have worked with / understand programmatic buying, dynamic creative, and attribution?      Create and execute ad operations workflow from client on-board through campaign launch - and strive to improve efficiency      Work closely with account teams to determine tagging strategy. Guide Ad Ops team on all upfront tracking and tagging implementation within GTM [or other relevant tag management platforms such as Tealium, Flashtalking, Adform]. Strong understanding of Floodlights, Pixels, Tagging, etc.      Work with the team to ensure data collection and proper performance tracking is in place - triage and solve technical issues within campaigns      Guide team members on the creation of campaigns within ad servers, programmatic platforms, and social partners based on approved specs - QA & troubleshoot pre-and post-campaign launch      Act as a primary liaison with client engineering/IT team, platform reps, publisher ad ops, and delivery teams      Assist Account Managers with the creation of reporting      Manage a small Ad Ops team and help to facilitate a positive and productive work environment. Mentor individuals and create career growth plans            The team         Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce, and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.        We serve our clients through the following types of work:            Cross-channel customer engagement strategy, design, and development (web, mobile, social, physical)      eCommerce strategy, implementation, and operations      Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions      Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions      Marketing analytics implementation and operations      Advertising campaign ideation, development, and execution Acquisition, and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results            Qualifications:             7+ years of experience in digital media and Ad Operations with an emphasis on programmatic display, native, video, CTV, and audio      Experience working with at least two of the following: DCM, DV360, The Trade Desk, Amazon DSP, StackAdapt, Simplifi, or Quantcast      Extensive experience working with a tag manager tool      Very high attention to detail and ability to synthesize large amounts of data into actionable information      Working knowledge of HTML, Rich Media, and Video/Connected TV and Audio Adserving      Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience      Travel up to 30% (While 30% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship now or at any time in the future            Preferred Qualifications:             2+ years of direct people management experience      Hands-on experience in Google Tag Manager & DoubleClick Campaign Manager      An understanding of the leading Direct Media Publications and DSPs in the market      A strong POV on how data deprecation will change the Programmatic & Media landscape      A strong POV around brand safety and experience with monitoring and blocking (DoubleVerify, IAS, etc.)      Experience working with dynamic creative ad-serving partners (i.e., Flashtalking, Innovid, etc.)      A general understanding of Search and Social digital media tactics      Understanding of analytic platforms such as Google Analytics      Technical skills including HTML, JavaScript & Flash        AMC2021        XMAMC2022

HEALTH IS THE REAL WIN  Join the Analytics & Behavior Change engineering team and help us pioneer a bold new approach to total health. Our purpose is clear: helping people on their path to better health.  As an Engineer on our team, you will design and deliver cloud native solutions for scalability, performance, and reliability. You will influence our overall strategy by helping define system architecture with a commitment to best practices that enable a high-quality platform. You will partner with data science and data engineering experts across the organization to develop features that ultimately improve health.  What does it take to thrive as an engineer in our organization?  You are a team player who is creative, responsible, and curious. You enjoy collaborating with others to move quickly in turning customer needs into codified solutions. You are excited to both learn from and teach those around you. You want the opportunity to grow your technical and professional skills while helping our business grow. You relish the opportunity to solve complex problems using technology to help people.   Required Qualifications  5+ years experience designing, building, and deploying scalable data pipelines to production on huge amounts of data 5+ years hands-on experience in: Python, Spark, Hive, Shell 3+ years experience designing, building deploying cloud native solutions 3+ years experience working within Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, YARN, etc) 2+ years experience developing solutions using RDBMS, HBASE, NiFi, etc. 2+ years experience with at least one document-oriented DB (MongoDB, CouchDB, etc) 1+ years hands-on experience writing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform or similar IaC tools Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing Experience monitoring and troubleshooting operational or data issues in data pipelines  COVID Requirements   COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.  You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.   Preferred Qualifications Preferred Qualifications :  Experience developing solutions using Message Systems, including RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc. Working knowledge of data structures, algorithms, distributed processing Working knowledge of implementation of machine learning algorithms in Spark MLlib, H2O, R or related libraries/packages Demonstrated ability to drive and articulate technical challenges and solutions. Demonstrated ability to create advanced architectures and sustainable solutions. Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality software through working in a dynamic, team-focused Agile/Scrum environment Experience collaborating with product and non-technical partners Experience with at least one RDBMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL, RDS, Oracle, etc) Hands-on experience with DevOps pipeline tools for code integration, automated testing, and deployment (Git, Jenkins/Groovy, etc.) GCP/AWS/Azure Certification(s) Graduate degree  Education Bachelor's degree required; Master's preferred   Business Overview At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart. About Us              BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc. (BTI) is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on drug development that utilizes artificial intelligence to identify improved therapies in neuroscience and immuno-oncology. We are a growing AI team that actively works with neuroscientists to build the next version of an AI eco-system that supports and augments the entire drug re-innovation process.                    Job Overview             The successful candidate will be part of a multidisciplinary effort to identify new potential indications for drugs that have a clinical safety profile as well as expanding on indications for drugs currently under development. He/She will work with the Artificial Intelligence and neuroscience group to develop and work with both structured and unstructured data to build a labeled properties graph for further graph-based data-science strategies. The end goal is to predict viable drug candidates for new opportunities, i.e., existing drugs with the right pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties, to be successful for indications in psychiatric and neuro-rare disorders. He/She must be willing to source and develop ingestion pipelines for big data.                          Responsibilities             Participate in planning and the execution of strategies to identify candidate compounds for their therapeutic potential in human neuro-psychiatric disorders, in particular ways of identifying and analyzing relevant data ingested into our databases.  Participate in team discussions with the neuroscience and artificial intelligence teams in Europe and the US  Implement analytics, AI methodologies and graph databases to assist in the search for existing drugs and in-licensing opportunities that may be used in novel neuro-rare or psychiatric indications.  Consult with the intellectual property team regarding scientific strategy of the IP estate.  Collaborate with the BTI AI advisory board, scientists and KOLs in the field of AI-based methodologies.  Participate in preparing presentations for use at corporate meetings, scientific conferences, and business development meetings.                          Qualifications             Curiosity and the professional skill set to excel in an open, highly collaborative environment.  MS degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioengineering, or related disciplines.  Working knowledge of the fundamentals of modern ML (neural networks, regularization, optimization, etc.) and of data engineering (model lifecycle, data storage, lineage).  Highly fluent in Python or related environments and experience using modern technologies to accelerate machine learning (e.g. PyTorch, scikit-learn, spaCy, etc.)  Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.  Experience with communicating complex concepts and methods to audiences with diverse technical backgrounds.  Familiarity with DL/ML methodologies  Definite Plus will be:  Familiarity with life sciences  Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4j.  Experience mining and integrating databases and developing data visualizations.  Enjoy collaborating with a diverse team of both technical and non-technical experts.                          Your Path to Endless Opportunities                   If you’re looking to push the envelope and join an innovative company where technology meets drug discovery and development and you’re enthusiastic, creative, with a passion for cutting-edge research, you should join our team! We are looking for highly motivated, passionate employees to help us drive technology solutions for discovering breakthrough treatments for our portfolio of oncology and neuroscience programs, as well as for our partners across major therapeutic areas.                  About BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc .                  BioXcel Therapeutics, Inc. is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on drug development that utilizes artificial intelligence to identify improved therapies in neuroscience and immuno-oncology. BTI's drug re-innovation approach leverages existing approved drugs and/or clinically evaluated product candidates together with big data and proprietary machine learning algorithms to identify new therapeutic indices. BTI's two most advanced clinical development programs are BXCL501, an investigational sublingual thin film formulation in development for acute treatment of agitation resulting from neuropsychiatric disorders, and BXCL701, an investigational orally administered systemic innate immunity activator in development for treatment of a rare form of prostate cancer and for treatment of pancreatic cancer in combination with other immuno-oncology agents. For more information, please visit www.bioxceltherapeutics.com.                  EOE/M/F/V/SO             BioXcel Therapeutics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status.

job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Applications Operations - Opportunity for Working Remotely Bridgeport, CT
job_Description: Come join the Buildpacks team at VMware and help us build the next generation of tools for creating container images at-scale for the world’s largest enterprises. In this role you will contribute to the Paketo project, developing best-in-class buildpacks and fostering a growing open source community. You will also develop commercial buildpacks for use in Tanzu Build Service and other Tanzu products.        In this role you will:         Contribute to the Paketo Buildpacks project (mostly in Golang)      Support the community by triaging incoming issues and feature requests      Providing help and guidance to users and new contributor      Participate in the design of new features and improvements to Paketo and Tanzu buildpacks      Build automation to ensure that we are always shipping the latest      Be a steward of code quality, ensuring a high standards of readability, maintainability, security, and performance.           Desired Skills & Experience        You have a passion for DevOps and DevSecOps. You know that a great developer experience and operational maturity don’t need to be in conflict and you are excited to build the tools that prove it. Whether you are a generalist who has broad experience with many language ecosystems or a specialist with deep experience in a single language, you understand the needs of application developers and are passionate about making their lives easier. You sweat the details. Developers trust you to help them get applications to production safely and you take that responsibility seriously. Above all, you are a team player, and you judge your success by the success of the project and the happiness of our customers and users.         Experience coding in Golang      Experience with Docker or other container runtimes      Experience writing automated tests, preferably TDD      Experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment methodologies      A solid understanding of Linux and linux software packaging      DevOps or DevSecOps experience           Additional Qualifications:         Expertise in one or more of the following areas      Developing web applications with NodeJS and/or Ruby      Developing .Net Core applications      Developing software for data science and/or machine learning use cases with Python and/or R      Containerizing applications for Windows      Experience using buildpacks or other container build tools (e.g. Dockerfile, kaniko, buildkit, jib, s2i, ko)      Prior contributions to open source products           Category :  Engineering and Technology   Subcategory:  Software Engineering   Experience:  Business Leadership   Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time   Posted Date:  2022-04-06     VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com. Our team helps clients optimise and align financial planning, consolidation, reporting and analytics processes, systems and information to provide business insights that drive better decisions and actions. To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future. As a Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail. Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required. Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism. Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart. Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements. Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust. Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct. Travel Requirements:  75%-80% weekly travel Degree Preferred : Accounting, Finance, Business Analytics, Information Technology   Preferred Knowledge/Skills : Demonstrate leading practice knowledge and proven experience across the EPM landscape including but not limited to: Close, Consolidation and External/Regulatory Reporting Planning, Budgeting and Forecasting including driver-based planning, capital and workforce planning, rolling forecasts and integrated planning Management Reporting including dashboarding and predictive analytics Costing and Profitability Management Key business drivers and metrics that provide performance insights Data Model and Chart of Accounts Data Management and Integrations Governance Demonstrate proven experience with consulting engagements pertaining to the requirements and design (functional and technical), configuration, testing and deployment of EPM solutions Experience developing the EPM Business Case to quantify and demonstrate the business value and return on investment. Demonstrated capabilities of designing and implementing holistic solutions including process optimization and organization structure design to augment EPM technical solutions. Demonstrate knowledge of the industry including common issues facing clients. Ability to work with ambiguity while addressing the clients' needs and delivering top-level results. Showcase strong communications skills and the ability to simplify complex information and influence stakeholders. Ability to create a positive environment by monitoring workloads of the team while meeting client expectations; providing candid, meaningful feedback in a timely manner; and keeping leadership informed of progress and issues. Ability to work collaboratively with a global team and all levels of an organization. Demonstrate knowledge of technologies that support collaboration, automation and data-driven story-telling including: Microsoft Products (Teams, PowerBI, MS Office), G-Suite (Google), and business intelligence tools Proficiency and/or willingness to learn digital technologies and the impact on Finance and Accounting including analytical tools. E.g. Alteryx, PowerBi, Tableau, Snaplogic and RPA technologies (UiPath, Automation Anywhere, PowerAutomate, etc), and machine learning/Artificial Intelligence Proven and thorough knowledge of operational metrics to support strategic plans, dashboard design and benchmarking/standard industry practices. Demonstrate knowledge and success in advising global organizations through transformations from strategy through execution. Experience with the following: Core Finance system implementation and optimization (e.g. ERP, EPM, etc) Finance strategy and transformation Shared service and outsourcing Cost management Talent management Success with analyzing detailed finance and accounting processes to identify improvement opportunities in the following areas: Process improvement (Record to Report, Order to Cash, Source to Pay, etc) Internal and external reporting People and organization structures Performance management, budgeting and forecasting Cash flow optimization and the use of capital Maintenance and building of cost-effective controls. Media Director, Manager - Experience Management - Advertising Performance         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services, or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels. Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and the Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end-to-end.         We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement, and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.        The Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data, and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale. We are seeking to transform the way brands interact with their customers and elevate the human experience. Do you have data in your DNA? Join our growing team in supporting our clients' ability to communicate the right message to the right customers at the right time.           Work you'll do         Deloitte Consulting is looking for an exceptional digital marketer with a strategic mindset who will serve as the day-to-day lead for internal account teams and communicate directly with the client. The Paid Media Supervisor will be responsible for understanding the client's business goals and challenges, developing holistic digital paid media strategy, and ensuring proper execution of integrated media strategies across paid digital channels such as (but not limited to) paid search, social, and display to drive performance. This role requires someone who can work closely with the channel, analytics, and audience lead to use data to provide strategic guidance on budget allocation, optimizations, and opportunities for growth.        Essential Functions:            Drive overall paid media strategy, budget allocation, and forecasting      Work closely with channel leads to create and execute digital tactics to meet client's businesses goals      Work closely with analytics team to analyze and utilize paid media data to drive strategy and uncover opportunities      Work closely with the audience team to ensure a holistic audience strategy is applied across all paid media channels      Work closely with advertising and marketing technology teams to utilize 1 st party data for media activation      Identify new opportunities within existing paid media channels and lead expansion into new digital paid media channels      Provide POV on industry changes, especially around data privacy      Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients            The team         Advertising, Marketing & Commerce         Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce, and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.        We serve our clients through the following types of work:            Omnichannel customer engagement strategy, design, and development (web, mobile, social, physical)      eCommerce strategy, implementation, and operations      Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions      Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions      Marketing analytics implementation and operations      Advertising campaign ideation, development, and execution      Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results            Required Qualifications             7+ years paid media experience      Strong knowledge of multiple digital channels and how they intersect (paid search, paid social, display a must, other channels a plus)      Experience managing multi-channel paid media strategy, budget allocation, forecasting, and execution      Experience directly managing either paid search, social, or display      Strong data analytics background      Ability to build strong relationships with clients and lead internal teams      Experience presenting digital marketing strategy to executive audiences      Effective time and project management skills      Strong written and oral communication skills      Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience      Travel up to 30% (While 30% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.              AMC2021         XMAMC2022

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your fields? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?         At Deloitte, we help bring client data to life to enhance the risk assessment process, reveal unexpected patterns and outliers and offer insights. The business world is complex and ever changing and, as a result, Deloitte is helping to redefine audit by infusing our approach with cutting-edge technologies, data analytics and visualizations, and transformative audit delivery models. Lead audit into the future by helping deliver a more dynamic picture to our clients that provides meaningful insights, empowers decision-making, and informs tomorrow's success.           Work you'll do         This position provides risk management and related support to the U.S. Audit & Assurance (A&A) Products and Solutions organization that develops and deploys innovative technology products and solutions to Deloitte's A&A business and its clients. This position is housed within the Technology Controls (TC) team, reporting to the Technology Controls Leader.        As a    Technology Controls - Risk & Compliance Senior , you will be responsible for driving the day-to-day Technology Controls activities to effectively identify regulatory, legal and compliance risk exposures, with a focus on quality, data protection and security matters related to our innovative products and solutions, environments, and frameworks at all stages with the software development lifecycle (SDLC) (e.g., design, development and deployment). This exciting and challenging role invites you to drive quality as part of the SDLC and ideate ways to creatively solve challenges and increase quality.        Under the guidance and supervision of a Technology Controls Manager or Senior Manager, you will drive quality as part of the SDLC using established risk and control frameworks (such as SOX, Security, Privacy, Confidentiality, Third Party or SOC/ISAE) to ensure that development, hosting, deployment and other risk decisions comply with existing firm policies, professional standards, laws and regulations, and other internal and external requirements. You will collaborate with various groups (such as, internal product and IT groups, Deloitte's vendors and IT service providers, and Global risk, regulatory and privacy teams) and will be required to understand their roles and responsibilities in the overall IT control structure. Further, you will prepare and/or validate control-related aspects of product risk assessments and confidential information management plans, as well as assist other TRM team members with reviewing functional and nonfunctional requirements (i.e., user stories and acceptance criteria) and testing scripts to ensure alignment with controls requirements. Additionally, you will be responsible for testing Information Used in the Execution of Controls (IUC) across our portfolio of products and solutions.           The team     Our audits are fueled by more than just technology - what really sets us apart are our insightful professionals, collaborative culture, and commitment to innovation and continuous improvement. Our audit professionals apply a streamlined, intelligent approach to the audit, enabled by innovative tools and technologies. Quality is our top priority, and by focusing on innovation, we continue to raise the bar on quality and deliver greater value to our clients. Learn more about Deloitte Audit.           Required Qualifications:     Candidates should have the following competencies and skills:            Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Accounting Information Systems, or other related degrees.      Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in audit or risk assurance, preferably with experience working on large and medium-size audits performed in accordance with the PCAOB standards, or internal audit experience on clients or companies that are subject to SOX compliance.      Strong internal controls and audit knowledge and prior experience reviewing and/or establishing business processes and controls in large public companies subject to PCAOB standards.      Ensure key deliverables (control testing, evaluation of test results, other items as requested, etc.) adhere to high quality standards.      Strong knowledge and understanding of, or the ability to learn, the regulatory requirements and professional standards involving the development, documentation, review, retention and archiving of evidence, including reproduction thereof for professional, legal or regulatory purposes.      Experience with establishing and/or reviewing controls over accuracy and completeness of key business reports (IUC).      Ability to apply concepts of risk assessment and professional skepticism.      Reasonable familiarity with audit or other regulatory technology applications.      Familiarity with data analytics and/or technology fueled by machine learning/AI.      Strong project management skills to keep multiple projects organized and deliver results under tight, demanding deadlines for a high-volume of products and releases while maintaining high-quality and precision.      Strong verbal and written communication skills.      Ability to challenge the status quo, and to identify untapped opportunities, alternate approaches, and creative solutions to audit products and solutions      Proactive approach and anticipation of potential challenges.      Work in cross-functional environments with professionals across Deloitte (non-auditors) and various geographic locations.      CPA/CA, CIA, CISA or CIPP required            Preferred qualifications:             Privacy certifications      Data quality and risk experience

Our flock represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Although confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job, we believe there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Corvus is a place where everyone can soar. So however you identify and whatever background you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day. And please check out what it's like to be a Corvid and our amazing benefits: https://www.corvusinsurance.com/life-at-corvus  Corvus is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation with our hiring process due to a disability, contact us at careers@corvusinsurance.com.  Disclaimer: Bird puns are highly encouraged!

Senior Product Manager, Healthcare Marketplace        Position Overview     As Product Manager for Change Healthcare Marketplace, you will drive the digital transformation of discovery and purchase of solutions. In this enterprise-wide role, you work with a cross-functional team including strategy, platform and business product managers, marketing, and sales to develop and execute strategies.     As a critical leader and collaborator, you will execute the strategy for and implementation of many large-scale, cross-functional business, technology, and growth initiatives aimed at making the Change Healthcare Marketplace a prime destination for exploring, learning, and purchasing of products and services. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys taking ownership and building features at all levels of the stack and requires a mix of analytical horsepower, relentless execution, and well-honed user judgment. You will learn to think holistically about a portfolio of products and the business deeply to set the right long-term direction across teams and partners.        What will I be responsible for in this job?         Define and drive a roadmap to accelerate how prospects and buyers discover, try, buy, and use Change Healthcare’s products using high quality, self-service experiences      Identify, prioritize, and execute on solutions to key problem spaces & opportunities by leveraging your product expertise and analytical insights and working cross-functionally with strategy, product, engineering, design, analytics, and sales teams      Engage and cultivate relationships with product and platform partners to influence shared cross-team directions and manage risks or trade-offs.      Coordinate and manage tradeoffs between engineering and design to ensure timely releases while delivering impactful results to support business growth      Define methods and metrics for identifying success and failure while ensuring the team is clear on their objectives.      Define, understand and improve key growth funnels, viral flywheels, and metrics.      Evangelize the digital transformation leveraging ecommerce tools and techniques           What Are The Requirements Needed For This Position?         6-8 years product management experience defining, delivering, and growing highly successful products in B2B or consumer tech; involved in end-to-end product process from conceptualizing, building, shipping, and scaling products      Previous experience with Marketplaces and deep understanding of buyers’ journey        What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?         Comfortable owning goals and metrics      Experience with engaging multiple user/buyer personas across eCommerce/engagement channels      Strong user experience sensibilities and familiarity with platform UI best practices.      Strong use of analytics, user research, and business cases to drive decisions and improve products.      Ability to operate under tight deadlines while maintaining multiple projects.      Experienced in planning work for assigned workstreams.      Experience in iterative product development building consumer-facing experiences, back-end processing, reporting and analytics, and machine learning. Full-stack software delivery experiences are a plus!        How much should I expect to travel?         Less than 10%      Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.           #li-remote     Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!        COVID Vaccination Requirements        We remain committed to doing our part to ensure the health, safety, and well-being of our team members and our communities. As such, we require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment and we may require periodic testing for certain roles. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. Change Healthcare adheres to COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. job_title: Reporting & Analytics Software Engineering Senior Manager - Evernorth - Work From Home
job_Description: We have an immediate opening for a technology people leader who can help with modernization and transformation of Reporting & Analytics applications (green field development). You will part of building a green field financial application that processes high volume and high value transactions between our supply side trading partners all the way to fulling our financial obligations with our clients and partners. In this role, you will actively partner with business stakeholders, subject matter experts, as well as your development team on initiatives that support Evernorth’s strategic goals. As a Software Engineering leader, you will help develop an integrated architectural strategy to support next-generation reporting and analytical capabilities on an enterprise-wide scale. You will work in an agile environment, delivering user-oriented products in a fast-paced environment.      You will be building and scaling a team to shift away from the current vendor driven approach we have today, as well as manage relationships with business stakeholders and engineering teams that are dependent on reporting and analytics platform capabilities.        Core responsibilities:    Data and analytical capabilities and architecture      Develop rock-solid, scalable systems that will still hold up 5, or 10 years from now      Drive opportunities to revolutionize workflow with embedded analytics, machine learning, and AI      Enforce modern delivery practices such as continuous integration, behavior/test driven development      Mine and analyze data from databases to drive optimization and improvement of current techniques and business strategies.      Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering technique      Understanding business products and defining high-level needs      Partner with the business on driving strategy from a product roadmap perspective, provide technical leadership      Provide your team with insight into the product roadmap and articulate technical direction and considerations      Encourage your team to start with the end in mind      Obsess with optimizing the product to achieve business goals while maximizing return on investment and business value      Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities to drive business solutions.      Lead a high performing team      Hire and retain strong software engineering talent      Develop existing talent into full stack engineers      Inspire engineering teams to take risks and manage them      Drive a culture of continuous improvement and accountability        Ideal Candidates Will Offer:   Attributes:    Has a passion for data, analytics, building self-service tools and web application platforms using the latest technologies      Solid managerial experience      Boundless intellectual curiosity to continually explore how to do things better, bigger, faster and cheaper      A strong voice for data integrity and reporting quality utilizing best practices and industry standards      A “roll-up your sleeves and get the job done” mentality      Enjoys speaking with customers to understand how we can best meet their needs      Team player and motivator      Technical and marketing skills to be able to craft and execute your own programs      Strong product management skills and ability to inspire software engineering teams      Experiences/Qualifications      Minimum 5 years of experience in Reporting & Analytics.      Minimum of 5 years of experience in software development and management      Knowledge and experience with agile development process a must      Prior experience with web development and solution architecture is required      Data mining and SQL experience      Skilled and experienced in some of the following technologies (S3, Ec2, Redshift database, Dynamo DB, Glue, Tableau)      Familiarity with AWS, cloud native application development, EC/EMR, and cloud data storage and access      DevOps and CICD technologies experience      Prior entrepreneurial or startup experience is desirable      Demonstrated experience with thorough problem solving and analytical skills, combined with strong business acumen      This role is WAH/Flex, which allows most work to be performed at home. WAH/Flex employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they choose to come onsite or if required to periodically come on site.      For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $126,400 - $210,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.      This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.      Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. While you take care of our customers, we’ll take care of you through a comprehensive benefits program that helps you be at your best. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and best in class well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and dozens of corporate discounts on essentials you use every day. For more details on our employee benefits programs, please visit the “Life at Cigna” tab on our careersite: www.cigna.com/careers      About Evernorth   Evernorth, Cigna Corporation’s health services segment, exists to elevate health for all. We're building on our legacy and redefining health care as we know it. Unbiased in how we think, we create without limitation. We partner without constraints, deliver value differently and act in the interest of humanity. Solving across silos, closing gaps in care, and empowering clients, customers, and people everywhere to move onward and upward. When you work with us, you’ll be empowered to solve the problems others don’t, won’t or can’t. Join us. What difference will you make?      Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.      If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.      If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.      Our Client      Our client started with an observation: In a world full of applications, why do documents and spreadsheets still run everything? And why haven't they been meaningfully updated in over 50 years? Their product is a new doc that's familiar and flexible like the documents you're used to, but comes with building blocks you can combine to create docs as powerful as apps. It's a big product with an even bigger mission. And they need your help to spread the word! They are backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, and have assembled a world-class team across offices in San Francisco, Mountain View, and Seattle, and remote employees all over the US. In fact, all their jobs are open in any location across the US. Here's a quick overview of what they do.            Role Overview                       As a growth engineer, you will increase our user base, their usage of the product, and their retention. You will work on features from SEO/SEM for lead generation, incentives for users to upgrade to our paid plans, new user experience, and retention. You will work with a stellar team of passionate, experienced engineers, data scientists, and product managers who have been instrumental in building some of the most widely-used technology products in the world, including YouTube, Google Drive/Docs, Google Shopping/Travel, Amazon AWS, Pinterest, and Microsoft Azure. You will report to one of three managers on our small, close-knit teams.                   Their application runs on React, TypeScript, Python, NodeJS, and sklearn and runs on Kubernetes in Amazon AWS. Their data stack uses Snowflake and Mode Analytics for dashboards. Our client believes in using the best tool for the job and don't shy away from solving complex problems!                       You will:               Work with the product, data, sales, content, and marketing teams to increase growth in users, usage, and retention         Work in a collaborative environment across multiple geo-located offices (Seattle, San Francisco, and Mountain View). Like many of our engineers, you can also work remotely         Help ensure our customers have an excellent experience finding, understanding, and using Coda         Participate in the engineering teams' on-call rotations for customer support and live production issues                        You have:               You have 2+ years of industry experience in a software engineering role and have a software engineering degree or equivalent experience         You have experience in growth engineering, SEO/SEM, A/B testing, and machine learning         You can process complex information, and dive into any part of our systems to promote growth         You are motivated and excel when challenged                                       Benefits                        Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance          401k          Optional Remote or in-office work          Commuter Benefits          Cell & Internet Subsidy          Lunch Subsidy          Fitness Subsidy          Parental Leave          Annual Educational Stipend                             Base Salary Range:  $100,000 to $200,000

job_title: Financial Planning & Analysis Consultant or Manager
job_Description: We are:  CFO-Enterprise Value, and we give finance execs the sounding board they need. Value isn’t just about maintenance. It’s about zeroing in on smart, sustainable ways to grow, and finding the right tools to keep everything on track. We’ve got the deep industry experience, the functional insights, the data power, and the digital tech leadership to help our clients make important changes. Whether we’re breaking down meaningful analytics, designing the perfect finance platforms, or building from current risk and compliance models to get ready for the future, we solve our clients’ toughest problems. Visit us here to find out more about CFO-Enterprise Value.     You are:  A problem-solver with the keen ability to diagnose a client’s unique needs. You can see the gap between where they are and where they need to be, and love creating a blueprint to get them there.     The work:                     Help clients modernize their finance functions by consulting with internal and external teams to understand strategy and goals, then managing your teams’ workflows        Find EPM solutions for clients and share leading practices across the industry        Provides solutions to complex business problems for area(s) of responsibility where analysis of situations requires an in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives        Involved in setting strategic direction to establish near term goals for area of responsibility        Create strategies and blueprints that use machine learning to improve operations and refine processes (financial planning & analysis, procure-to-pay, order-to-cash, record-to-report) Walk clients through digital transformations, help them find operational efficiencies        Interacts with middle to senior management levels at a client and/or within Accenture        Has latitude in decision-making and determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments. Decisions have a lasting impact on area of responsibility with the potential to impact outside area of responsibility        Manage small to medium teams and/or work efforts (if an individual contributor) at a client or within Accenture        Support new business by contributing to thoughtful proposals        Stay on top of current regulations, trends, and technologies influencing EPM, analytics, and the CFO ecosystem                 Travel:  For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.  Please note:  The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.                              Here’s what you need:                     Minimum 3 years’ of finance and management consulting experience        Minimum 3 years’ experience with finance functions (analytics, forecasting, core finance), including operating models, supporting organization structures, and process leading practices        Working knowledge of Finance technologies. This may include, but not limited to financial close and consolidations, data, planning, budgeting, analytics, reporting and enabling technologies.        Bachelor’s degree                             Bonus points if:                     You’ve implemented finance, accounting, planning, forecasting, or reporting solutions with clients        You’ve worked with these Finance and Performance Analytics Enabling Technologies: Board, OneStream, Anaplan, Cognos, SAP SAC, SAP BPC, SAP Group Reporting, Oracle Hyperion, Oracle EPM Cloud, Tableau, Workday - Adaptive Insights        You’re comfortable with ERP technology and know your way around SAP, Oracle, Workday        Solid project management experience including defining scope, setting project timelines and milestone, driving deliverables, identifying risks, managing issues, and client relationship management        Demonstrated ability to clearly communicate with clients, lead key requirement workshops, document and understand requirements        Strong competence in developing executive level presentations required (MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel))        You have experience leading projects and/or teams        You’ve got an MBA after your name or another type of advanced degree                 As required by Colorado law under the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act,   Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado  only , the range of starting pay for this role i s  $90,288 - $167,600  and  information on benefits offered is here.                   COVID-19 update:      The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually.      Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process.      What We Believe      We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization.
